member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.AutoCatalog
member.summary: A catalog of all available AutoML tasks.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.AutoCatalog.CreateRegressionExperiment(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates a new AutoML experiment to run on a regression dataset.
member.param: Maximum number of seconds that experiment will run.
member.returns: A new AutoML regression experiment.

remarks.para: See for a more detailed code example of an AutoML regression experiment.

An experiment may run for longer than . This is because once AutoML starts training an ML.NET model, AutoML lets the model train to completion. For instance, if the first model AutoML trains takes 4 hours, and the second model trained takes 5 hours, but was the number of seconds in 6 hours, the experiment will run for 4 + 5 = 9 hours (not 6 hours).

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.AutoCatalog.CreateRegressionExperiment(Microsoft.ML.AutoML.RegressionExperimentSettings)

member.param: Settings for the AutoML experiment.
member.returns: A new AutoML regression experiment.
member.remarks: See for a more detailed code example of an AutoML regression experiment.

An experiment may run for longer than . This is because once AutoML starts training an ML.NET model, AutoML lets the model train to completion. For instance, if the first model AutoML trains takes 4 hours, and the second model trained takes 5 hours, but was the number of seconds in 6 hours, the experiment will run for 4 + 5 = 9 hours (not 6 hours).

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.AutoCatalog.InferColumns(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Char},System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Infers information about the columns of a dataset in a file located at .
member.param: Path to a dataset file.
The name of the label column.
The character used as separator between data elements in a row. If , AutoML will try to infer this value.
Whether the file can contain columns defined by a quoted string. If , AutoML will try to infer this value.
Whether the file can contain numerical vectors in sparse format. If , AutoML will try to infer this value.
Whether trailing whitespace should be removed from dataset file lines.
Whether to group together (when possible) original columns in the dataset file into vector columns in the resulting data structures. See for more information.
member.returns: Information inferred about the columns in the provided dataset.
member.remarks: Infers information about the name, data type, and purpose of each column. The returned can be used to instantiate a . The can be used to obtain an that can be fed into an AutoML experiment, or used elsewhere in the ML.NET ecosystem (ie in . The contains the inferred purpose of each column in the dataset. (For instance, is the column categorical, numeric, or text data? Should the column be ignored? Etc.) The can be inspected and modified (or kept as is) and used by an AutoML experiment.

The can be used to obtain an that can be fed into an AutoML experiment, or used elsewhere in the ML.NET ecosystem (ie in . The contains the inferred purpose of each column in the dataset. (For instance, is the column categorical, numeric, or text data? Should the column be ignored? Etc.) The can be inspected and modified (or kept as is) and used by an AutoML experiment.

member.summary: Inferred for the dataset.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInferenceResults.ColumnInformation
member.summary: Information about the inferred columns in the dataset.

remarks.para: Contains the inferred purposes of each column. See for more details.
This can be fed to the AutoML API when running an experiment. See for example.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInformation
member.summary: Information about the columns in a dataset.

remarks.para: Contains information about the purpose of each column in the dataset. For instance, it enumerates the dataset columns that AutoML should treat as categorical, the columns AutoML should ignore, which column is the label, etc.
can be fed to the AutoML API when running an experiment. See for example.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInformation.LabelColumnName
member.summary: The dataset column to use as the label.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInformation.UserIdColumnName
member.summary: The dataset column to use as a user ID for computation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInformation.ItemIdColumnName
member.summary: The dataset column to use as a item ID for computation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInformation.ExampleWeightColumnName
member.summary: The dataset column to use for example weight.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInformation.SamplingKeyColumnName
member.summary: The dataset column to use for grouping rows. If two examples share the same sampling key column name, they are guaranteed to appear in the same subset (train or test). This can be used to ensure no label leakage from the train to the test set. If , no row grouping will be performed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInformation.CategoricalColumnNames
member.summary: The dataset columns that are categorical.
member.value: The default value is a new, empty .
member.remarks: Categorical data columns should generally be columns that contain a small number of unique values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInformation.NumericColumnNames
member.summary: The dataset columns that are numeric.
member.value: The default value is a new, empty .

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInformation.TextColumnNames
member.summary: The dataset columns that are text.
member.value: The default value is a new, empty .

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInformation.IgnoredColumnNames
member.summary: The dataset columns that AutoML should ignore.
member.value: The default value is a new, empty .

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInformation.ImagePathColumnNames
member.summary: The dataset columns that are image paths.
member.value: The default value is a new, empty .

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ExperimentBase`2
member.summary: AutoML experiment base class. All task-specific AutoML experiments (like ) inherit from this class.
member.typeparam: Metrics type used by task-specific AutoML experiments.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ExperimentBase`2.Execute(Microsoft.ML.IDataView,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.ML.IEstimator{Microsoft.ML.ITransformer},System.IProgress{Microsoft.ML.AutoML.RunDetail{`0}})
member.summary: Executes an AutoML experiment.
member.param: The training data used by the AutoML experiment.
The dataset column used as the label.
The dataset column used as the sampling key column. See for more information.

Pre-featurizer that AutoML will apply to the data during an experiment. (The pre-featurizer will be fit only on the training data split to produce a trained transform. Then, the trained transform will be applied to both the training data split and corresponding validation data split.)
A user-defined object that implements the interface. AutoML will invoke the method after each model it produces during the course of the experiment.
member.returns: The experiment result.
member.remarks: Depending on the size of your data, the AutoML experiment could take a long time to execute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ExperimentBase`2.Execute(Microsoft.ML.IDataView,Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInformation,Microsoft.ML.IEstimator{Microsoft.ML.ITransformer},System.IProgress{Microsoft.ML.AutoML.RunDetail{`0}})
member.summary: Executes an AutoML experiment.
member.param: The training data to be used by the AutoML experiment.
Column information for the dataset.

Pre-featurizer that AutoML will apply to the data during an experiment. (The pre-featurizer will be fit only on the training data split to produce a trained transform. Then, the trained transform will be applied to both the training data split and corresponding validation data split.)
A user-defined object that implements the interface. AutoML will invoke the method after each model it produces during the course of the experiment.
member.returns: The experiment result.
member.remarks: Depending on the size of your data, the AutoML experiment could take a long time to execute.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ExperimentSettings
member.summary: Base class for experiment settings. All task-specific AutoML experiment settings (like ) inherit from this class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ExperimentSettings.MaxExperimentTimeInSeconds
member.summary: Maximum time in seconds the experiment is allowed to run.
member.value: The default value is 86,400, the number of seconds in one day.
member.remarks: An experiment may run for longer than . This is because once AutoML starts training an ML.NET model, AutoML lets the model train to completion. For instance, if the first model AutoML trains takes 4 hours, and the second model trained takes 5 hours, but was the number of seconds in 6 hours, the experiment will run for 4 + 5 = 9 hours (not 6 hours).

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ExperimentSettings.CancellationToken
member.summary: Cancellation token for the AutoML experiment. It propagates the notification that the experiment should be canceled.
member.remarks: An experiment may not immediately stop after cancellation. This is because once AutoML starts training an ML.NET model, AutoML lets the model train to completion. For instance, if the first model AutoML trains takes 4 hours, and the second model trained takes 5 hours, but cancellation is requested after 6 hours, the experiment will stop after 4 + 5 = 9 hours (not 6 hours).

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ExperimentSettings.CacheDirectory
member.summary: This is a pointer to a directory where all models trained during the AutoML experiment will be saved. If , models will be kept in memory instead of written to disk. (Please note: for an experiment with high runtime operating on a large dataset, opting to keep models in memory could cause a system to run out of memory.)
member.value: The default value is the directory named "Microsoft.ML.AutoML" in the current user's temporary folder.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ExperimentSettings.CacheBeforeTrainer
member.summary: Whether AutoML should cache before ML.NET trainers. See for more information on caching.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ExperimentSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.CacheBeforeTrainer
member.summary: Whether AutoML should cache before ML.NET trainers. See for more information on caching.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.CacheBeforeTrainer.Auto
member.summary: Dynamically determine whether to cache before each trainer.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.CacheBeforeTrainer.On
member.summary: Always force caching on.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.CacheBeforeTrainer.Off
member.summary: Always force caching off.

member.summary: Select the best run from an enumeration of experiment runs.

Metric to consider when selecting the best run.

Metric to consider when selecting the best run.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.CrossValidationRunDetail`1
member.summary: Details about a cross validation run in an AutoML experiment.
member.remarks: Over the course of an experiment, many models are evaluated on a dataset using cross validation. This object contains information about each model evaluated during the AutoML experiment.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.CrossValidationRunDetail`1.Results
member.summary: Results for each of the cross validation folds.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TrainResult`1
member.summary: Result of a pipeline trained on a cross validation fold.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TrainResult`1.ValidationMetrics
member.summary: Each fold has training data and validation data. A model trained on the folds's training data is evaluated against the validation data, and the metrics for that calculation are emitted here.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TrainResult`1.Model
member.summary: Model trained on the fold during the run.
member.remarks: You can use the trained model to obtain predictions on input data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TrainResult`1.Exception
member.summary: Exception encountered while training the fold. This property is if no exception was encountered.
member.remarks: If an exception occurred, it's possible some properties in ths object (like ) could be .

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.RunDetail`1
member.summary: Details about an AutoML experiment run.
member.remarks: Over the course of an experiment, many models are evaluated on a dataset. This object contains information about each model evaluated during the AutoML experiment.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.RunDetail`1.ValidationMetrics
member.summary: Metrics of how the trained model performed on the validation data during the run.
member.remarks: Internally, each run has train data and validation data. Model trained on the run's training is evaluated against the validation data, and the metrics for that calculation are emitted here.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.RunDetail`1.Model
member.summary: Model trained during the run.
member.remarks: You can use the trained model to obtain predictions on input data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.RunDetail`1.Exception
member.summary: Exception encountered during the run. This property is if no exception was encountered.
member.remarks: If an exception occurred, it's possible some properties in ths object (like ) could be .

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.RunDetail
member.summary: Details about an AutoML experiment run.
member.remarks: In trying to produce the best model, an AutoML experiment evaluates the quality of many models on a dataset. This object contains information about each model tried during the AutoML experiment.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.RunDetail.TrainerName
member.summary: String name of the trainer used in this run. (For instance, "LightGbm".)

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.RunDetail.RuntimeInSeconds
member.summary: Runtime in seconds.
member.remarks: Runtime includes model training time. Depending on the size of the data, the runtime may be quite long.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.RunDetail.Estimator
member.summary: An ML.NET that represents the pipeline in this run.
member.remarks: You can call on this estimator to re-train your pipeline on any .

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnGroupingInference
member.summary: This class incapsulates logic for grouping together the inferred columns of the text file based on their type and purpose, and generating column names.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnGroupingInference.GroupingColumn
member.summary: This is effectively a merger of and a with support for vector-value columns.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnGroupingInference.InferGroupingAndNames(Microsoft.ML.MLContext,System.Boolean,Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnTypeInference.Column[],Microsoft.ML.AutoML.PurposeInference.Column[])
member.summary: Group together the single-valued columns with the same type and purpose and generate column names.
member.param: The host environment to use.
Whether the original file had a header. If yes, the fields are used to generate the column names, otherwise they are ignored.
The (detected) column types.
The (detected) column purposes. Must be parallel to .
member.returns: The struct containing an array of grouped columns specifications.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnGroupingInference.GetRanges(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Generates a collection of Ranges from indices.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInferenceValidationUtil.ValidateSpecifiedColumnsExist(Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInformation,Microsoft.ML.IDataView)
member.summary: Validate all columns specified in column info exist in inferred data view.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInformationUtil.GetColumnNames(Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInformation)
member.summary: Get all column names that are in .
member.param: Column information.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnTypeInference
member.summary: This class incapsulates logic for automatic inference of column types for the text file. It also attempts to guess whether there is a header row.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnTypeInference.Experts
member.summary: Current design is as follows: there's a sequence of 'experts' that each look at all the columns. Every expert may or may not assign the 'answer' (suggested type) to a column. If the expert needs some information about the column (for example, the column values), this information is lazily calculated by the column object, not the expert itself, to allow the reuse of the same information by another expert.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnTypeInference.InferTextFileColumnTypes(Microsoft.ML.MLContext,Microsoft.ML.Data.IMultiStreamSource,Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnTypeInference.Arguments)
member.summary: Auto-detect column types of the file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.PurposeInference
member.summary: Automatic inference of column purposes for the data view. This is used in the context of text import wizard, but can be used outside as well.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.PurposeInference.IPurposeInferenceExpert
member.summary: The design is the same as for : there's a sequence of 'experts' that each look at all the columns. Every expert may or may not assign the 'answer' (suggested purpose) to a column. If the expert needs some information about the column (for example, the column values), this information is lazily calculated by the column object, not the expert itself, to allow the reuse of the same information by another expert.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.PurposeInference.InferPurposes(Microsoft.ML.MLContext,Microsoft.ML.IDataView,Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInformation)
member.summary: Auto-detect purpose for the data view columns.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TextFileContents
member.summary: Utilities for various heuristics against text files. Currently, separator inference and column count detection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TextFileContents.TrySplitColumns(Microsoft.ML.MLContext,Microsoft.ML.Data.IMultiStreamSource,System.Char[])
member.summary: Attempt to detect text loader arguments. The algorithm selects the first 'acceptable' set: the one that recognizes the same number of columns in at least of the sample's lines, and this number of columns is more than 1. We sweep on separator, allow sparse and allow quote parameter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TextFileSample
member.summary: This class holds an in-memory sample of the text file, and serves as an proxy to it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TextFileSample.CreateFromFullStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Create a by reading multiple chunks from the file (or other source) and then stitching them together. The algorithm is as follows: 0. If the source is not seekable, revert to . 1. If the file length is less than 2 * , revert to . 2. Read first MB chunk. Determine average line length in the chunk. 3. Determine how large one chunk should be, and how many chunks there should be, to end up with * MB worth of lines. 4. Determine seek locations and read the chunks. 5. Stitch and return a .

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TextFileSample.CreateFromHead(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Create a by reading one chunk from the beginning.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TextFileSample.StitchChunks(System.Boolean,System.Byte[][])
member.summary: Given an array of chunks of the text file, of which the first chunk is the head, this method trims incomplete lines from the beginning and end of each chunk (except that it doesn't trim the beginning of the first chunk and end of last chunk if we read whole file), then joins the rest together to form a final byte buffer and returns a wrapped around it.
member.param: did we read whole file
chunks of data

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TextFileSample.IsEncodingOkForSampling(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Detect whether we can auto-detect EOL characters without parsing. If we do, we can cheaply sample from different file locations and trim the partial strings. The encodings that pass the test are UTF8 and all single-byte encodings.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.RecipeInference.AllowedTrainers(Microsoft.ML.MLContext,Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TaskKind,Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ColumnInformation,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TrainerName})
member.summary: Given a predictor type, return a set of all permissible trainers (with their sweeper params, if defined).
member.returns: Array of viable learners.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SuggestedPipeline
member.summary: A runnable pipeline. Contains a learner and set of transforms, along with a RunSummary if it has already been exectued.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SuggestedTrainer.PropagateParamSetValues
member.summary: make sure sweep params and param set are consistent

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.PipelineSuggester.GetTopTrainers(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SuggestedPipelineRunDetail},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SuggestedTrainer},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get top trainers from first stage

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.PipelineSuggester.SampleHyperparameters(Microsoft.ML.MLContext,Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SuggestedTrainer,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SuggestedPipelineRunDetail},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Samples new hyperparameters for the trainer, and sets them. Returns true if success (new hyperparams were suggested and set). Else, returns false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ISweeper
member.summary: The main interface of the sweeper

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ISweeper.ProposeSweeps(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.ML.AutoML.IRunResult})
member.summary: Returns between 0 and maxSweeps configurations to run. It expects a list of previous runs such that it can generate configurations that were not already tried. The list of runs can be null if there were no previous runs. Some smart sweepers can take advantage of the metric(s) that the caller computes for previous runs.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.IValueGenerator
member.summary: This is the interface that each type of parameter sweep needs to implement

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.IValueGenerator.CreateFromNormalized(System.Double)
member.summary: Given a value in the [0,1] range, return a value for this parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.IValueGenerator.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Used mainly in grid sweepers, return the i-th distinct value for this parameter

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.IValueGenerator.Count
member.summary: Used mainly in grid sweepers, return the count of distinct values for this parameter

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.IValueGenerator.Name
member.summary: Returns the name of the generated parameter

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.IParameterValue
member.summary: Parameter value generated from the sweeping. The parameter values must be immutable. Value is converted to string because the runner will usually want to construct a command line for TL. Implementations of this interface must also override object.GetHashCode() and object.Equals(object) so they are consistent with IEquatable.Equals(IParameterValue).

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.IParameterValue`1
member.summary: Type safe version of the IParameterValue interface.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ParameterSet
member.summary: A set of parameter values. The parameter set must be immutable.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.IRunResult
member.summary: The result of a run. Contains the parameter set used, useful for the sweeper to not generate the same configuration multiple times. Also contains the result of a run and the metric value that is used by smart sweepers to generate new configurations that try to maximize this metric.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.RunResult
member.summary: Simple implementation of IRunResult

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.RunResult.IsMetricMaximizing
member.summary: This switch changes the behavior of the CompareTo function, switching the greater than / less than behavior, depending on if it is set to True.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.RunMetric
member.summary: The metric class, used by smart sweeping algorithms. Ideally we would like to move towards the new IDataView/ISchematized, this is just a simple view instead, and it is decoupled from RunResult so we can move in that direction in the future.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.RunMetric.PrimaryMetric
member.summary: The primary metric to optimize. This metric is usually an aggregate value for the run, for example, AUC, accuracy etc. By default, smart sweeping algorithms will maximize this metric. If you want to minimize, either negate this value or change the option in the arguments of the sweeper constructor.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.RunMetric.GetMetricDistribution
member.summary: The (optional) distribution of the metric. This distribution can be a secondary measure of how good a run was, e.g per-fold AUC, per-fold accuracy, (sampled) per-instance log loss etc.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.LongValueGenerator
member.summary: The integer type parameter sweep.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.FloatValueGenerator
member.summary: The floating point type parameter sweep.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.DiscreteValueGenerator
member.summary: The discrete parameter sweep.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.UniformRandomSweeper
member.summary: Random sweeper, it generates random values for each of the parameters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SmacSweeper.GenerateCandidateConfigurations(System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.ML.AutoML.IRunResult},Microsoft.ML.Trainers.FastTree.FastForestRegressionModelParameters)
member.summary: Generates a set of candidate configurations to sweep through, based on a combination of random and local search, as outlined in Hutter et al - Sequential Model-Based Optimization for General Algorithm Conguration. Makes use of class private members which determine how many candidates are returned. This number will include random configurations interleaved (per the paper), and thus will be double the specified value.
member.param: Number of candidate solutions to return.
History of previously evaluated points, with their emprical performance values.
Trained random forest ensemble. Used in evaluating the candidates.
member.returns: An array of ParamaterSets which are the candidate configurations to sweep.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SmacSweeper.GreedyPlusRandomSearch(Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ParameterSet[],Microsoft.ML.Trainers.FastTree.FastForestRegressionModelParameters,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.ML.AutoML.IRunResult})
member.summary: Does a mix of greedy local search around best performing parameter sets, while throwing random parameter sets into the mix.
member.param: Beginning locations for local greedy search.
Trained random forest, used later for evaluating parameters.
Number of candidate configurations returned by the method (top K).
Historical run results.
member.returns: Array of parameter sets, which will then be evaluated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SmacSweeper.LocalSearch(Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ParameterSet,Microsoft.ML.Trainers.FastTree.FastForestRegressionModelParameters,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs a local one-mutation neighborhood greedy search.
member.param: Starting parameter set configuration.
Trained forest, for evaluation of points.
Best performance seen thus far.
Threshold for when to stop the local search.
Whether SMAC should aim to maximize (vs minimize) metric.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SmacSweeper.GetOneMutationNeighborhood(Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ParameterSet)
member.summary: Computes a single-mutation neighborhood (one param at a time) for a given configuration. For numeric parameters, samples K mutations (i.e., creates K neighbors based on that paramater).
member.param: Starting configuration.
member.returns: A set of configurations that each differ from parent in exactly one parameter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SmacSweeper.GetForestRegressionLeafValues(Microsoft.ML.Trainers.FastTree.FastForestRegressionModelParameters,Microsoft.ML.AutoML.ParameterSet[])
member.summary: Goes through forest to extract the set of leaf values associated with filtering each configuration.
member.param: Trained forest predictor, used for filtering configs.
Parameter configurations.
member.returns: 2D array where rows correspond to configurations, and columns to the predicted leaf values.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SmacSweeper.ComputeForestStats(System.Double[][])
member.summary: Computes the empirical means and standard deviations for trees in the forest for each configuration.
member.param: The sets of leaf values from which the means and standard deviations are computed.
member.returns: A 2D array with one row per set of tree values, and the columns being mean and stddev, respectively.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SignatureSweeperFromParameterList
member.summary: Signature for the GUI loaders of sweepers.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SweeperBase
member.summary: Base sweeper that ensures the suggestions are different from each other and from the previous runs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SweeperProbabilityUtils.NormalRVs(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Samples from a Gaussian Normal with mean mu and std dev sigma.
member.param: Number of samples
mean
standard deviation

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SweeperProbabilityUtils.BinarySearch(System.Double[],System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Simple binary search method for finding smallest index in array where value meets or exceeds what you're looking for.
member.param: Array to search
Value to search for
Left boundary of search
Right boundary of search

member.name: F:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SweepableParams.AllHyperparameterNames
member.summary: The names of every hyperparameter swept across all trainers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SweepableParams.GetAllSweepableParameterNames
member.summary: Gets the name of every hyperparameter swept across all trainers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TrainerExtensionUtil.UpdateFields(System.Object,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SweepableParam})
member.summary: Updates properties of object instance based on the values in sweepParams

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TransformInference
member.summary:
Auto-generate set of transforms for the data view, given the purposes of specified columns.
The design is the same as for : there's a sequence of 'experts' that each look at all the columns. Every expert may or may not suggest additional transforms. If the expert needs some information about the column (for example, the column values), this information is lazily calculated by the column object, not the expert itself, to allow the reuse of the same information by another expert.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TransformInference.InferTransforms(Microsoft.ML.MLContext,Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TaskKind,Microsoft.ML.AutoML.DatasetColumnInfo[])
member.summary: Automatically infer transforms for the data view

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TransformInference.BuildFinalFeaturesConcatTransform(Microsoft.ML.MLContext,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SuggestedTransform},System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.ML.AutoML.TransformInference.IntermediateColumn})
member.summary: Build final features concat transform, using output of all suggested experts. Take the output columns from all suggested experts (except for 'Label'), and concatenate them into one final 'Features' column that a trainer will accept.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SplitUtil.TrainValidateSplit(Microsoft.ML.MLContext,Microsoft.ML.IDataView,System.String)
member.summary: Split the data into a single train/test split.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.AutoML.SweepableParam
member.summary: Used to indicate suggested sweep ranges for parameter sweeping.
